Our 4 member Truvée wine team are passionate and creatively gifted women.

Our vision for Truvée is to create elegant, finely balanced wines that are not heavy handed and express distinct individuality. Stylistically Truvée bridge wines that sit between old world and new world; no flaws, no polarizing flavors or characteristics, just unique blends, showcasing finesse from some of our best vineyard locations on the Central Coast.

The terroir is a very important influence on the Central Coast. The micro-climates, soils, topography and even latitude degree change within every vineyard influences quality. This is not a homogenized region and sustainability is at the forefront of all our growing efforts. First off, because it’s the right thing to do. Second it integrates environment, social and economic structure. Third, it contributes to better quality and balance is everything:

Vine balance = wine chemistry balance, which leads to quality.

- Stasi Seay Vineyard Director

"The winemaking style focuses on preserving varietal character developed in the vineyard while creating distinct wines through blending to achieve a sum that is greater than its parts. Each component enhances and elevates the overall blend."

- Monica Belovic Chief Winemaker
